com.agsimeonov.flogger.backend.fluentd

Class SystemPropertiesLevelDisabler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.agsimeonov.flogger.backend.fluentd.SystemPropertiesLevelDisabler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FluentdLevelDisabler

    public class SystemPropertiesLevelDisabler
extends Object
implements FluentdLevelDisabler
    Determines whether logging is disabled at specific levels based on system properties.

    To configure this level disabler for Flogger set the following system properties (also see FluentdBackendFactory):

    • flogger.level_disabler=com.agsimeonov.flogger.backend.fluentd.SystemPropertiesLevelDisabler#getInstance.
    • flogger.exclusive=<true/false>.
    • flogger.<name>=<true/false>.
    • flogger.level=<integer>.

      • getInstance

        public static FluentdLevelDisabler getInstance()

      • isLoggable

        public boolean isLoggable(Level level)
        Determines whether given levels are loggable via system properties.

        This outcome method is configured using the following system properties:

        • flogger.exclusive=<true/false>.
        • logger.<name>=<true/false>.
        • flogger.level=<integer>

        If flogger.exclusive is not set returns true.
        If flogger.exclusive is set to true and logger.<name> is set to true returns false.
        If flogger.exclusive is set to true and flogger.level is set returns true if parameter level is greater than flogger.level.
        Otherwise if flogger.exclusive is set to true returns true.
        If flogger.exclusive is set to false and logger.<name> is set to true returns true.
        If flogger.exclusive is set to false and flogger.level is set returns true if parameter level is greater than or equal to flogger.level.
        Otherwise if flogger.exclusive is is to false returns false.
        Specified by:
        isLoggable in interface FluentdLevelDisabler
        Parameters:
        level - the given level.
        Returns:
        true if the given level is loggable, otherwise false.
